ftm-ppe-cta: Let's get our PPE into the hands of those who need it!
ftm-requester-near-me: Search for a requester near you. Not sure how to give? Read our FAQ.
ftm-ack-data-sources: This site also includes data from https://tinyurl.com/hospitals-needing-ppe, a project by:
ftm-add-donation-site-question: Want to join the #findthemasks map? Need to update or remove info?
ftm-collaboration-with: Made in collaboration with #findthemasks.
ftm-index-need-find-masks: We need to find the masks
ftm-index-site-coalition: A member of the PPECoalition
ftm-canada-made-with-love: Made by Canadians with <3 by findthemasks.ca
ftm-made-with-love: Made with <3 in Seattle by findthemasks.com
ftm-maps-search-placeholder: Search by city, zip, or address
ftm-site-launch-info: This site was launched on March 19th by Rachel Popkin and has been improved by many fantastic volunteers. Many of us are tech workers in Seattle. We are advised by a group of doctors and nurses around the country.
ftm-volunteer-network: Our network of volunteers has created a global map of over 4000+ locations, like hospitals and clinics, where you can donate your masks, gowns, and other PPE.
ftm-comments-questions: Got a comment or suggestion not related to data updates? Want to help?
ftm-us-contact-info: Email us at contact@findthemasks.com or join us on our Github.
ftm-canada-contact-info: Email us at COVID19donationsCA@gmail.com or join us on our Github.
ftm-cant-find-donation-site-question: Can't find a donation site near you?
ftm-cant-find-donation-site-answer: Not a problem! Some PPE requests include mailing addresses. Find a request site that accepts mail-in donations, and follow the instructions for that site.
ftm-large-donation-question: Need logistical help or compensation to donate 500+ items of PPE?
ftm-us-can-want-to-mail-link: Our partners at Mask Match can help.
ftm-canada-large-donations: Please visit the province-specific (British Columbia, Ontario, New Brunswick, Nova Scotia) if you have large donations, or the national efforts (Federal call for manufacturers, Federal call for suppliers) if you are a manufacturer or supplier.
ftm-canada-no-donation-sites-near-me: Email COVID19donationsCA@gmail.com to let them know where you are and what you have available. A volunteer will get back to you.
ftm-default-large-donations: Our partners at getusppe.org/give have an intake form where you can register, and a volunteer will get back to you.
ftm-default-no-donation-sites-near-me: Visit getusppe.org to let them know what you have available.
ftm-thanks-companies: A special thanks to the following companies:
ftm-thanks-smartling: Smartling for access to their Translation Managment Platform
ftm-tweet-share-button: Find the closest place to donate masks and other PPE at www.findthemasks.com
ftm-index-og-description: Find where you can donate your masks or other personal protective equipment (PPE) in your local area.
ftm-default-og-description: America's frontline healthcare workers are treating COVID-19 patients without adequate protective gear, risking their lives! We need to find the masks. All of these masks can save lives now if you get them into the hands of healthcare workers.
ftm-faq-what-is-ppe-answer: Personal protective equipment (PPE) is protective clothing, goggles, or other equipment designed to protect the wearer from injury or infection. In this case, we are looking for PPE to protect our frontline healthcare workers from infection by COVID-19.
ftm-faq-what-ppe-needed-answer:
Each site is unique! Our request sites are looking for many kinds of equipment, including N95 masks, safety goggles, bunny suits, face shields, gowns, and disposable booties. Many sites have requested additional items such as hand sanitizer, thermometers, and walkie-talkies.
          Each listing has a complete list of items that they need, as well as whether they accept open packages or non-medical grade items. Refer to the card to see if you have something that a healthcare worker needs!
          Some sites have requested homemade masks and 3D-printed or makerspace items. If you are part of a makerspace community or can contribute homemade items, see our Makerspace Community FAQ.
ftm-faq-who-donating-to-answer: Our website includes Level I Trauma Centers across the country, but we also feature a broader scope of healthcare providers (HCPs) such as community healthcare clinics, long-term care facilities, blood banks, shelters, and more. We are committed to getting PPE to all of our frontline workers during the pandemic. For more information on the full list of HCPs we support, check out our wiki.
ftm-faq-vet-requires-ppe: How do you know these sites require PPE?
ftm-faq-vet-requires-ppe-answer: Healthcare providers, administrators, or regional Partners in need of PPE have filled out our PPE request form. After the form is submitted, our dedicated data team moderates every single request before publishing it to our site.
ftm-what-to-do-1: Use our map below to find a hospital or health center near you accepting donations.
ftm-what-to-do-2: Follow their instructions for what they accept and how to drop it off.
ftm-what-to-do-3: If you are donating opened packages, please put them in a ziploc bag with a note saying whether they have been used, whether anyone in your household has been sick or travelled outside the country, and the expiration date if known.
ftm-faq-open-packages: What if I have open packages of PPE?
ftm-faq-open-packages-answer-1: If you are donating opened packages, make sure the receiving site accepts them! Each contact card will indicate this information. When you're ready, place the opened packages in a ziploc bag and include a note with the following information:
ftm-faq-open-packages-answer-2: Under what conditions have they been stored? Backyard paint job? Construction? Art? Other? Let the requesting site know so they can provide it to the correct unit (regular hospital use vs. ICU).
ftm-faq-open-packages-answer-3: Whether anyone in your household has been sick, travelled, or come in contact with someone who has travelled in the last 14-days.
ftm-faq-how-decide-location: How do I decide which location to donate to?
ftm-faq-how-decide-location-answer-1: If you're looking for a place to start, we suggest entering your address or city into our search tool to find donation sites near you. You can also filter listings to see sites that are looking for the PPE items that you can contribute.
ftm-faq-how-decide-location-answer-2: Make sure that you read each site's donation instructions carefully; some sites will accept open packages or homemade items, while others do not!
ftm-faq-how-decide-location-answer-3: Once you've found a few possible sites, choose one that aligns with your values and donation size. There are a wide variety of sites that need PPE, and ultimately, the choice is yours. You will be helping protect our frontline healthcare workers no matter which you choose!
ftm-faq-how-to-help-answer-1: We would love it if you helped us share our project on social media and within your networks! Sharing our site helps new healthcare providers find us, and it helps our healthcare providers connect with more potential PPE contributors!
ftm-faq-how-to-help-answer-2: Join our amazing team of volunteers at here.
ftm-faq-makerspace-how-to-help: I make handmade masks, 3D-print face shields, or am part of a makerspace community! How can I help?
ftm-faq-makerspace-how-to-help-answer-1: First of all, amazing! Thank you for taking the time to make new PPE supplies!
ftm-faq-makerspace-how-to-help-answer-2: Please use our map to help you identify frontline sites requesting PPE that allow non-medical grade donations. You can use our "PPE needed" filter to select "homemade" or "makerspace" items, which will show you the locations that can receive your items.
ftm-faq-sites-non-medical-grade: Why don't all sites allow non-medical grade items?
ftm-faq-sites-non-medical-grade-answer-1: As much as our recipients need PPE, they must also manage the risk incurred by using non-medical grade items. Many institutions do not have the resources to vet all of the contributions they receive from various donors, and some are more comfortable only using the medical-grade items that they are familiar with and know they can rely on.
ftm-faq-sites-non-medical-grade-answer-2: To ensure that your contributions are not wasted, please filter healthcare providers by "handmade" or "makerspace" items to locate the ones that can use your contribution!
ftm-faq-request-processing-length: How long will it take for my request to be processed?
ftm-faq-request-processing-length-answer: After you submit the PPE request form, our volunteer team of data moderators check every submission before publishing your request to our map and directory. In some cases, this can happen as quickly as a few minutes after submission! On average, it takes about two hours for a listing to be published.
ftm-faq-my-data: What happens to my data? Who owns the data that I submit?
ftm-faq-my-data-answer-1: We collect the information that you provide to us when you fill out our PPE request form. The information regarding PPE recipient sites will be published on our public website for anyone to see and use. We also request an email and a phone number that we do not disclose publicly, so that we may contact the user in case we need to elaborate the post, seek feedback or request a collaboration. We may process your data or share personal information with vendors, consultants, or other third-party service providers.
ftm-faq-my-data-answer-2: For more information, please see our Privacy Policy.
ftm-faq-listing-not-shown: I submitted a listing but it hasn't shown up yet. What should I do?
ftm-faq-listing-not-shown-answer: If it has been less than 4 hours, hang tight! We sometimes get surges of requests, and our data moderators may be working through the backlog. If it has been more than 12 hours, email contact@findthemasks.com.
ftm-makers-og-description: Find where makerspaces are creating personal protective equipment (PPE) in your local area.
ftm-makers-cta: Make PPE and get it into the hands of those who need it!
ftm-makers-near-me: Search for a Makerspace near you. They can help distribute things you've made or find you the supplies you need.
